Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: wints3
Reviews.Content: We arrived on spec not knowing what to expect but were fortunate to find a hidden gem. A perfectly located spot, well served by restaurants and within easy walking distance of attractions.The staff we re very attentive and helpful and offered us alternative rooms away from where refurbishment work was ongoing . Whilst being on the small size, the rooms were well equipped and our room facing the road was welcoming. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A good location”
Reviews.Author: funtimefreddy699
Reviews.Content: A simple hotel in a good location with very helpful staff. In particular the concierge service could not have done more. Probably quite pricey for what you get but I guess you are paying for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Recent stay at the Hotel Bel Ami Paris”
Reviews.Author: Lulu255100
Reviews.Content: I booked on line. I have stayed a few times before. I was given a room off a corridor that was being renovated.Some floors including the floor my room was on were nothing more than a building site! No one advised me that the hotel was being renovated, The hotel was charging full rates. My room was changed when I requested to be moved. Next morning at 7 am builders were on site and the noise began in earnest. I checked out and went to another hotel, where to my surprise I met another couple I knew, who had the same experience that I had ie. they had booked into the Bel Ami, were given a "dirty room" at 475 Euros per night and moved out the next day. It was really not good enough. I will never stay there again. I advise anyone wanting to stay there to check before going if the renovations are completed.

Reviews.Title: “Great design and fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: Sophie J
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend in Paris in January and booked a room at Hotel Bel-Ami. It is perfectly loacted in the heart of the very fancy St Germain area. The room was superbly decorated, following the latest Parisian design and the staff was extremely kind and helpful. In the morning, we had breakfast in the restaurant downstairs, which had both what you would expect of a continental breakfast with a number of original and healthy additions. Overall, a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “A small hotel with a LOCATION not to be beat!”
Reviews.Author: bkaley
Reviews.Content: This small but rather comfortable 5 star hotel is located right off the Boulevard St. Germain around the corner from the Cathedral St. Germain and within a stones throw of Le cafe deux Magots and the Cafe Flore. If these spots do not register one is not a true lover of authentic and historic Paris. Next door, Le petite zinq is a very good restaurant , although not ranked as one of Paris' best. The Metro station is within a five minute walk and alows access to all of Paris. This hostoric area is home to Le Sorbonne and what used to be Mom and Pop quaint shops have given way to designer shops like Dior, Vesache, and other high fashion brands. You will be close to the Louvre, the Musee Dorse and Notre Dame. The smells and sounds will take you back to Paris and it's romance anytime you think of them. You owe it to your Paris self not to miss this location. If you need to spend a little less but seek the same location, the hotel Boneparte a 36 Rue Bonepart will fill the bill. It is right around the corner from Rue Benoit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Location is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ggdriscoll
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The location was close to Notre Dame, and other attractions. Very easy to work out this location. A complete, delicious breakfast was included. The room was large for Europe and the bath was great. Free wi-fi We could not have asked for better,

Reviews.Title: “High Marks for Hotel Bel Ami!”
Reviews.Author: debbiedoesdctoo
Reviews.Content: A friend and I decided to visit Paris for the first time and another friend had reccomended Hotel Bel Ami. It was the perfect pick for us. Aside from being in a great, central location, it is a lovely place to stay. In particular, the staff was exceptional both before and during the trip. I have already reccomended Hotel Bel Ami to other friends who are planning to visit Paris, and I definitely would stay there again. Thanks to Hotel Bel Ami for making our stay so lovely! d. marshall

Reviews.Title: “Midnight in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: nevercominghome
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Bel Ami at midnight on the 30 th December and were greeted by the friendly staff who showed us to our superior rooms . What a dreamy week celebrating new years eve wandering the streets of Paris and finding jazz clubs Yet again the staff at the Bel Ami were superb. The concierge staff are incredibly helpful and the bell staff are always greeting us with smiles. The rooms are excellent and the location is spectacular, just off saint Germaine de pres and rue Jacob also around the corner from the metro This one of many visits to the Bel Ami and hopefully there will be many more to come. Thank you for a magical week.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: citimomma
Reviews.Content: The rooms are TINY but clean and the decor is lovely and modern. The breakfast is lovely. And you cannot possibly beat the location, steps away from St. Germain and the two most famous cafes - Cafe de Flore and Deux Magots. But, do not plan to spend any time in your room - it's simply a clean, modern place to sleep. The bathrooms are so small you can touch the walls, but again they are clean and well decorated. My only major complaint is that the carpets really need to be replaced or cleaned - there is visible dirt.

Reviews.Title: “Really a spruced-up 3 star hotel....”
Reviews.Author: AD_RocketMan
Reviews.Content: My biggest complaint about this place is that the rooms are really small, at least the one I stayed in. By small I mean you will be hard pressed to walk around your bed without walking sideways, really small. The lighting in the room is also very dim which makes it a bit annoying. The bathroom sink is also small and the shower fitting needed maintenance. The water pressure is also quite low, even though I was in the second floor. Still an OK hotel with comfy beds, free internet, and friendly staff, but I will probably try to stay in a different hotel next time I'm in Paris. Even though it is supposedly a 4-star hotel, I would say it is more like a 3 spruced-up 3-star hotel, say, 3 ½ stars.

Reviews.Title: “Not good value for money but comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: GralindaSWLondon
Reviews.Content: I don't have much to compare this to in terms of Paris hotels, but am an experienced traveller and the room was very small compared hotels of comparable standard/price in other places. The professional photos on the web are a little misleading and it was disappointing to arrive to a room you could hardly move in. The lack of space, in addition to the fact that the bathroom decor was very basic (and not to the standard you would expect from the photos), is not very good value for the price. However, the bed was comfortable and the pillows were nice.The staff made a good effort on reception but the reception and bar had a cold 'designer' atmosphere and there was a very strong smell of paint near the lifts and spa due to maintenance work. I wouldn't return.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpfull staff rooms very small”
Reviews.Author: Mickburg
Reviews.Content: Great hotel , great location. Staff are amazing but rooms very small and cramped .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Bel Ami”
Reviews.Author: Getawayfromtheuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Bel Ami for three nights to celebrate our Anniversary, and it did not disappoint. On arrival we were greeted by lots of pleasant staff, all of which spoke next to perfect English, and were escorted straight to our room where we were offered a map of Paris, a bottle of water and a small box of Laduree macaroons to get us settled in.  The room itself was above expectations. I was expecting a small box room by Paris standards, but it was a great size, with a slight view of the Saint Germain des Pres Church, and all the amenities you could want, including comfy bathrobes and slippers, cute little toiletries, lots of fluffy towels, a hair dryer, a nice big wardrobe and easily accessible Wifi. However, I would say the room needed a little extra space for clothes. There was plenty of hanging space but not much else and I found myself living out of my bag a little.  The hotel is not huge, but the atmosphere is great. The decoration was very modern throughout, and I loved the selection of hat paintings hung throughout the first floor. The  corridors and room were always quiet at night, considering that the hotel is just up the road from the bustling Boulevard Saint Germain. We generally found it got a little noisier around 9/10 am when the maids started cleaning the rooms, but we were usually getting up by then anyway. There was always plenty of staff at hand to help with a range of queries, and always with a smile. The concierge were all very helpful. We visited the Cirque du Soleil during our stay (which I would highly recommend) but it was a little out of the way so the gentleman went over the best routes to take to get us there and also recommended, and booked us a table at one of the nicest restaurants we had ever eaten in. Hotel Bel Ami's key selling point is its prime location. We were in walking distance to just about everything; 10 minutes to The Louvre and The Siene where there is a convenient stop to get on and off the 'batobus' boat which will take you up and down the river. 15 minutes walk to Notre Dame and Jardin de Luxembourg, with a nice stroll through Saint Germain. 20 minutes to Musee de Orsay, and around 30/40 minutes to the Eiffel Tower.  It is also 2 minutes from Boulevard Saint Germain, where there is a huge array of restaurants, bistros and patisseries, including the Infamous Cafe de Flore and Les Deux Magots. And for the shopper in you, everything from Louis Vuitton and Armani, to Zara and Gap, and cheap supermarkets to get some reasonably priced drinks.  Check out was nice and smooth. They offered to hold onto our bags so that we didn't have to carry them around on our last day, and they booked us a taxi to the airport at very short notice. We were even invited to have a couple of glasses of champagne at the bar to celebrate our anniversary. There was an additional charge on top of what we had already paid for our trip to cover tax, but it was only 9euros.  I would definitely return to this charming hotel and highly recommend it to anybody wanting a lovely clean hotel room in a lovely clean hotel, filled with pleasant staff and right in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel--Great Location on Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: happytravls
Reviews.Content: The Bel Ami was the perfect place for my daughter and I to stay on a recent trip to Paris. The hotel staff and concierge were very helpful in making recommendations on restaurants, providing directions and they had museum tickets, boat cruise tickets and concert tickets available. The daily breakfast was a great way to start the day and having free wi-fi in the rooms (as well as use of public computers in lobby) was a nice touch. The rooms/baths were not particularly spacious, but that is not to be expected at a boutique hotel. The rooms were clean, well-appointed and the beds were comfortable. We loved the location and price and would consider staying at Bel Ami again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: RoamingReader
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights here on the 4th or 5th floor and found the rooms not spacious but adequate, and quiet at night. Breakfast was great. Free computers in the lobby were helpful. The main negative for us was the steep cost; the main positive was the staff. They were so helpful, never snobbish, always friendly. We appreciated them very much!

Reviews.Title: “Teenie Room, Great Location, Lovely Breakfast -- What More Could You Want?”
Reviews.Author: drisSeattle
Reviews.Content: Well, perhaps you'd like a bigger room. In Paris. Wouldn't we all? But that would cost a lot and really, you're in Paris, so how much time are you spending in your hotel room -- awake? Me, I was awake for about 45 minutes -- er, in the hotel room. For that much time, I will gladly sleep in a very comfortable bed in a quiet room (and I am such a pick about this), and not be terribly bothered about the piles of clothes, etc. I have to walk around to get to the bathroom. Not a big deal. Its Paris, remember? Then, on to a very nice hotel breakfast. Truth be told, I have never had a bad hotel breakfast in France, but this one covers many bases for eaters -- fresh fruit, yogurt, pastries, eggs, meats, coffee, juice -- much more than your basic meal. I had this fantasy of losing weight in Paris while walking a bunch and seeing all the smoking toothpicks... oh well. Breakfast is the most important meal of the day -- and that was my SAT exam prep talk. So there. Location-wise, this hotel is perfect. I felt like I could walk out the door and go comfortably in either direction -- preferably toward Laduree... but truly, the location is perfect for someone wanting to feel not so immersed as a tourist, yet comfortable. Eight years ago, my husband and daughter (then a bit of 11 years old) spent a few days in Paris and stayed here. Eight years later, we enjoyed a long weekend here. So, it is memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, outstanding concierge, wonderful room!”
Reviews.Author: SR22
Reviews.Content: In St Germain, blocks from the Louvre, close to Metro. In the heart of small quaint shops and restaurants. The concierge staff is AMAZING here. They got us museum tickets, made restaurant recommendations, knew us by name. The room service was impeccable, they never missed a cleaning or turndown service. An in-house co-ed dry sauna in the basement was welcome after chilly Paris days. Nice workout facility. Hotel lobby is beautiful, rooms are modern, updated but warm and friendly. We loved this hotel!!! We stay in hotels over 300 nights a year, this one is definitely worth a repeat visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff but disappointing room & housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: 100Manchester
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 nights at the Bel Ami and for the first time, I feel inclined to leave a review on Trip Advisor. The Pro's No-one can fault the fantastic location of this hotel, right in the heart of Saint Germain. Reception and Concierge staff were all excellent - friendly and very helpful. The Con's We had booked a package and were given a room on the first floor. The room was on the small side, but that's to be expected in Paris. However the window was so narrow that the room was really dark - we needed the lights on all the time. Also we were immediately facing the major renovations on the building opposite - so I can tell you that French builders arrive at 7.30am! The housekeeping was poor. I had to ask for toiletries to be replaced when empty, and the box of cotton buds, shower cap, etc was not replaced at all. Presumably you're only allowed 1 for 5 days! We used the drinking glasses on the first day, and although I kept putting them in a prominent position, they were just replaced on the tray dirty! We had a turndown service on the first night, but never again. The quality of breakfast items was good, but the choice was fairly limited. Steer clear of the mini-bar - a Coke was 8 Euros Having looked at other reviews of this hotel, I can only assume that the rooms vary enormously as ours was very disappointing. In my opinion, these basic rooms are very over-priced. I would have rated this hotel much lower if it had not been for the superb location and excellent staff. It was such a shame that the room/housekeeping did not match that standard.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bel-Ami”
Reviews.Author: Elbow16
Reviews.Content: A great find in great location -- Saint Germain des Pres. Modern, nice decor. Decent sized room. Friendly helpful staff in lobby. I've stayed on two separate trips and would return again. Good for couples or singles travelling on their own.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic trip in Paris”
Reviews.Author: GuillaumeRooke
Reviews.Content: Great location in a very romantic area in Paris. We did enjoy everything in the Hotel as soon as we crossed the door : Concierge, front desk, room service. We loved the decoration of the Suite, especially the pictures of Brigitte Bardot. The breakfast was amazing and the staff very professional. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Left bank gem”
Reviews.Author: Barelle78
Reviews.Content: After years( too many ) of posh right bank hotels we picked the BEL AMI for our family vacation. The location was perfect .- one block from st. germain and the exciting shops and cafes of the left bank. The front desk and the concierges were great , helping us in so many ways with a smile. NO attitude. A small gym and sauna and a very nice room for breakfast completed the lobby area. The rooms, on the smallish side, were quiet, very well furnished.and perfect for our needs. The rates were good for Paris and we departed feeling years younger and very Parisian.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish chic and intimate”
Reviews.Author: Gerryirishman
Reviews.Content: my wife and I stayed in this fabulous hotel at the end of June 2011 for 5 nights. The hotel is well located in the St Germain district of Paris. Its a pretty upmarket area full of stylish shops, restaurants, cafes and boutiques. The hotel is on Rue de Benoit which is a narrow little street of boulevard St Germain. It is a small boutique type hotel with restaurant bar etc. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms though smallish were well presented and cleaned daily. We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis and breakfast was very good each morning with lots of choice from the buffet.We never had dinner in the hotel, so cant comment about that. Restaurant and bar staff were always friendly and polite and could not do enough for you. We ate out each evening as there is so much choice in the surrounding area its difficult to choose where to go and also difficult to get a table. The concierges were extremely helpful especially Alexandre who was able to advise on best places to go and tips on best ways to see the sites and get around Paris. Having stayed in hotels in different parts of the world we couldnt really fault this hotel: its as it says on the tin! If you want a large plush hotel with a large expansive foyer where you can sit and people watch and spend most of your time in and around the hotel then this is not the place for you. But if you want to enjoy this beautiful city and get out and around and base yourself in a nice and central location where you can come back to after a hard days sightseeing or shopping for a drink or snack, before sliding up to bed: then book into the Bel Ami.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic hideaway”
Reviews.Author: lilianwilder
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arranged to stay here for our wedding anniversary and we were very pleased with our choice. The hotel is centrally situated with good transport links and within a few hundred yards of the Seine, with The Louvre then adjacent on the opposite bank. Other Parisian landmarks are also easily accessible by foot or Metro. The Hotel itself is well furnished with a good range of services and excellent "petite dejeuners". Not surprisingly however, it is the Staff who are the most important ingredient and in this respect we received superb treatment. They were welcoming, friendly, helpful and yet also very professional. Whilst they are all a credit to the Hotel, special mention has to be made for Elodie and Emily. Thanks to all who made our stay in Paris so special...

Reviews.Title: “So great, we're going back!”
Reviews.Author: aggy84
Reviews.Content: We can't fault the hotel at all! Fantastic location for everything, the cafes, bars, boutique clothes shops etc. It's in the centre of the very stunning Saint Germain My boyfriend and I had a wonderful time staying the hotel. The venue was beautiful and the staff were fantastic, they made our stay very enjoyable. Everything was efficient and nothing ever seemed too much bother to sort out, making the stay all the more relaxing! We are intending to go back in November because we loved it that much! xx

Reviews.Title: “have not been here for 9 years and that had all my details.”
Reviews.Author: demain
Reviews.Content: totalled changed, welcoming reception staff espcially Miss Emily,everyone with smiles and bonjour. Rooms are smallish but very comfortable anquiet with great beds and pillows and spotless. Bathroom well done althought shower was not well sited and difficult to use. lighting and chaairs were fine. Brown colours throught very ala mode. free umbrellas which were nice touch. Concierge was helpful thoughtful and always was able to get a taxi, important in a sopping wet Paris. well done Bel Ami a bientot alain

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Globalnaut
Reviews.Content: The hotel was terrific. The front desk and concierge were very friendly and spoke English (for those who don't speak French). Found the room to be spacious for Europe. I've not stayed in any other hotel in Paris, but had the larger room which included a small sofa in a carved out section of the room. The bathroom was modern and well done. No tub, just a shower. The room was on a corner but the street on which the hotel sat is fairly quiet given the activity just a block down the street. Also, the hotel is across the street from a restaurant that apparently many Parisians frequent just to eat the special beef they make -- which was good! The other restaurant just below the hotel was also a great place to sit and see and to eat. Used the concierge to book train tickets and he was extremely helpful. The breakfast in the morning was okay but it was good enough to get you going in the morning. The hotel was perfectly situated to be a short walk across the bridge to the Louvre. Of course, most other Paris sites are within walking distance... except maybe the Eiffel Tower. It was walkable, but it was a long walk. Notre Dame was not too far away. Would definitely consider staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Nevken
Reviews.Content: We came to the Bel Ami to experience Paris for the first time. We were pleased to have stayed in this hotel as it had seemed that it had just been renovated. Although the furniture in the breakfast room was in need of an update, we found it to be a complete contrast to the rest of the hotel including the room, which were all tastefully decorated sophisticatedly.. We did not go to Paris to stay in the hotel as it was a short weekend break to celebrate out anniversary, thus the 4 star rating we felt was more than adequate for this hotel. Let's face it, Paris IS expensive and the location of the hotel within it's culturally diverse surroundings helped to make our stay even more enjoyable. Prices were comparable with being in London's Westend. We found the hotel staff friendly and attentive and we thoroughly enjoyed an evening a few doors down at a Live Jazz Restaurant with customers messages scribbled all over the walls and decor. We would recommend this hotel if you want to be in the centre of Paris to enjoy Parisian culture and of course - shopping!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: PaulandElaine7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Paris for the first time in May 2011 and stayed at the Bel Ami. The staff was exceptional and they went out of their way to help us navigate our way around Paris. Neither one of us speaks French, so it was reassuring and comforting to find that most of the staff speaks English very well. Great location. Felt safe. Clean, modern rooms. I would definately stay there again!! I have already recommended this hotel to 3 other American couples.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: EllenBea
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week during a work convention in Paris (stayed in same hotel last summer for same convention) and loved it even more this time. The rooms may seem a bit tight for some but as a New Yorker I didn't mind. The bed and bathroom were very clean each and every day, the concierge Alex was super helpful with everything our group needed. Breakfast at the hotel has been the topic of conversation at our office for the past year, yes it's that unreal. I would go back a hundred more times.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and most helpful concierge”
Reviews.Author: jack06
Reviews.Content: Really lovely hotel in the most fabulous location on Rue Saint Benoit. Rooms are very nice with nice products, slippers and bathrobes. Staff are very friendly and helpful - particularly the concierge. They were more than happy to recommend and book restaurants, and give any advice needed.

Reviews.Title: “Location, boutique and clean”
Reviews.Author: Mmilp11
Reviews.Content: This was the second time at the bel ami for me. The location is just amazing!!!! The rooms are a little small but very clean and enough for paris life. The staff was very helpful, the concierge was amazing helping us with restaurant recommendations and things to do. Everything was great. The breakfast was delicious and offered a lot of choices. It was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: Amber009
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel in a quiet street, close to life on Saint-Germain-des-Prés. Friendly staff. Bar with a quiet atmosphere. I really recommend this hotel for the quality of its services, its design, particularly its atmosphere. A contemporary french poet, Nicolas Greneir, has even immortalized the hotel in a sweet tanka: In Rue Visconti / I count on the fingertips / Hotel Bel Ami / Four and half stars / Sigh in a junior suite

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: annisCi
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 5 nights at this hotel. The staff are pleasant and helpful, the rooms small but with plenty of storage. The bathroom was modern, clean and with ample toiletries. A very enjoyable stay and my teenagers loved the area. The Cafe Flor and Club Montane are just up the road. The Eurostar package is a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad, but overpriced hotel, even for Paris”
Reviews.Author: Stan040
Reviews.Content: I only stayed for one night, the most general impression was that the hotel badly needs refurbishment and renovation, especially the corridors and rooms. The staff is friendly and helpful, the breakfast is delicious and the district is really nice - very central and full of nice cafes and restaurants, but... I would not repeat.

Reviews.Title: “what a rip-off!”
Reviews.Author: Marionpauw
Reviews.Content: We paid 425 euro's a night for an extremely small room in a not so great hotel. For this amount of money we expected something fabulous, but instead we got a very dated room (ocre yellow and terrocatta-colors, so eighties) with a not properly working shower.I couldn't even wash my hair because the water pressure was so low. And this was supposed to be a superior room! Of course, Paris is an expensive city where square meters count, but this was such a rip-off! The location is great, but there are more charming hotels on the block that offer way better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but very charming staff”
Reviews.Author: siede
Reviews.Content: I only stayed for a night at the Bel-Ami this time. I wished to stay for 2 more nights but unfortunately they were fully booked and I had to move to another hotel. I already knew the rooms were tiny as I had stayed with them before. Tiny but cosy. I don't feel claustrophobic in ther rooms. They always had and still have good service, great bell desk members and unbelievably cool and efficient Concierge. Plus, I can tell the hotel hotel services have ameliorated since I last stayed with them (somehow, I had the impression that the staff were feeling more "a l'aise" so their happiness reflects on you). And somehow the room also felt more "sympa" with red/brown warmer tones this time. All of the staff is very friendly. The only thing left to be ameliorated is the room service waiting times.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: natalie_1111
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located near the church of St. Germain du pres (close to 2 metro stations) and unlike most parisian hotels, it is modernly styled and very tastfully decorated. The rooms are small but very nicely designed, and you definitly fill pampered. The hotel staff is extremly nice and helpfull, and breakfast is rich and luxurious. There is free internet in the lobby, and live jazz playing in the bar on the evening. All in all It was a great stay at a wonderful hotel, and a place I will definatly come back to.

Reviews.Title: “bonjour Its our pleasure”
Reviews.Author: britalyMiami
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Bel Ami several times in its earlier years but this was our first visit for 5 years and it was by far our best. The new management and the Bel Ami team could not have been more charming, helpful or tried harder all with that little bit of extra French sophistication .The location of course is unbeatable .Its perfect for enjoying the 6th and a great walk to Musee Branly, the eiffel, fondation cartier,the Rodin, the Grand Palais ,loads of designer shops , great cafes and some very inexpensive and excellent bistros. I think they must be in the process of steadily redecorating the rooms moving from the old palette of orange and other colors to something more slick for our room on the first floor was excellently decorated and well thought out for a smaller room. Incidentally all rooms in the 6th are small and if well organized which ours was (even more than enough hangers) for the well organised and sophisticated travellersmall rooms can be as cosy and enjoyable as that romantic little bistro table in your favorite restaurant just down the road. My advice is try and book a newly decorated room hopefully they all will be soon and shop for your rate and if possible try and get the really excellent breakfast in your rate. But do shop for your rate as the rack rate on a Rive Gauche room is a little high . The buffet is the best we have had in Paris. We stay in Design /boutique hotels always when we travel for pleasure and enjoyed some good ones in Italy and Spain on earlier trips this year and indeed in the Marais before moving to the BA. We very highly recommend this hotel.The team there is bright, fun and thoroughly professional. Do however visit the Marais, Bastille etc if you have the time. The metro and the cabs are right outside. A

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location on the Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: vivelafete
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Bel Ami and thoroughly enjoyed every minute of it. The service is excellent as was the newly refurbished room which, whilst not overly large, was stylish and chic. The whole operation was very professional and I shall return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ceciljuco
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small even the superior room we have, but that to be expected in European boutique hotel and we are in Paris to do sightseeing, shopping,etc. not hang out in your room. Our room is clean, the staff are great from your housekeeping and all the way up. The concierge are very helpful, friendly and pleasant, my husband and I are both pleasantly surprised. They put us in the courtyard, although its not really a courtyard but it is very quiet. The location of the hotel is great in quiet little street (compared to the boulevard) but still right at the heart of St. Germain de Pres. Walked around the corner the two famous cafes (Cafe de Fiore and Cafe Magoux) are there as well as the shopping area. We'll definitely come back to Bel Ami Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too small and a wall and ventilators in front of window”
Reviews.Author: DasAuge
Reviews.Content: General: clean, good service. Location: quiet, well situated in St. Germain. Room: we had the Superior Room and it was still too small for that price! The other rooms are even smaller (see attached pictures, plan of rooms)! The room was situated to the back so the only view we had was a wall with loud air condition ventilators in the court. Room Nr.: 202 Bathroom: very tiny, only for one person at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “So much for romantic Paris - our room looked out onto a factory!!”
Reviews.Author: juls63
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a leisure trip to Paris. Our room was disappointing for the price we paid - small, and looked out onto adjoining industrial premises. Bathroom also tiny. Location good for Paris attractions and some lovely little bistros and restaurants nearby. Drinks prices in hotel extortionate; breakfast good and lots of choice. Overall a decent base for a stay but nothing special and for the price paid, not great value.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel...great location...great staff.”
Reviews.Author: giggy19
Reviews.Content: My wife and children (ages 15, 13 and 10) stayed at the Bel Ami for more than a week. We loved it. It's a small, comfortable, first rate hotel. The service is exceptional -- from our check-in through multiple trips to the concierge, we were greeted warmly and often by our name. (We ended up being stuck in the hotel 5 extra days due to the volcano -- the staff was very, very helpful to all.) It would be hard to imagine a finer neighborhood in which to stay. Everything was a short walk away (except perhaps for the Eiffel Tour) and the atmosphere was lively, not overly touristy, and very safe. We even let our oldest child out on his own to navigate the city himself. A special note. We chose this hotel partially due to its handicapped accessibility. (One of our children is in a wheelchair.) The hotel worked great. Elevators were plenty large (an issue in small hotels in Paris) and we could maneuver the chair into and out of the hotel effortlessly. The only possible criticism of the hotel is that the neighborhood is a bit noisy at times. Often this is just the sounds of Parisian cafe life. It's part of the charm in my book -- but if you want absolute silence in your room, you just may be a bit disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: joejulie
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well situated in St. Germain. Rooms are small but adequate. Gym is also very small and would only be able to handle 3 or 4 people at a time.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: smuk08
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and the staff is kind but its too expensive for what it is. They advertise it as a charming design hotel but the furniture of our room were pretty tired and far from we know as design.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & concierge service for mother/adult daughter trip”
Reviews.Author: Michelle219
Reviews.Content: Concierges were excellent-set up a private tour to Champagne Region on Easter Sunday, with only a half day's notice. Were also great with tips on Metro & train lines, restaurants, etc. Neighborhood is very lively, but hotel is extremely quiet. We felt comfortable walking around at late night. 10 minute walk to Louvre, Metro around the block. Bedding & pillows very comfortable; modern bath with good hair drier, makeup mirror, robes, slippers. Full breakfast came with our rate-very good and varied. We requested a twin room-two beds pushed together; perfect for me & my daughter, but I wouldn't mind that setup if I were with my spouse either-European doubles are usually too small for 2 adults. Free WIFI in room, plus 2 Macs in lobby-pretty good speed & very reliable service.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous and good service, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: jialoong
Reviews.Content: About 3 miniutes from the metro. The staff are courteous, though some are efficient but 'cold'. The breakfast selection is one of the better ones i came across in Paris. Nice rooms. A little pricey though.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING !”
Reviews.Author: currieinc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights with our 3 young children in a interconnecting room & suite . What an amazing hotel this is ... I'm a Travel Agent from Sydney Australia and sell this hotel quite often .. this was the first time I'v seen the hotel and if you like funky & modern then this is the place to stay in the St Germain area. The rooms are not large but have a very cool decor , warm colors and excellent use of space. The bathroom is small but OK . Each room has everything you can imagine , often in the most unusual compartment - very well designed , the rooms large large windows that you can open , a very comfortable bed , iPod docking station and flat screen TV. The staff are excellent and couldn't be more helpful , the location is fantastic - surrounded by some of the best restaurants - all of varying cost , the metro is at the top of the street . The street is very narrow but quiet , even with the fact there are several bars around . The hotel had a cool bar and compact business centre ( a room with all the equipment you need in the basement ) If you are looking for a funky cutting edge hotel in a fantastic area of Paris - then you must book the Bel Ami .

Reviews.Title: “A very charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: GraceLombardia
Reviews.Content: In the heart of St.Germain, close to the famous Cafè de Flore. Nice staff. The rooms are small as the most hotel in Paris, but clean and confortable. Only one fault: the carpet in the room. I warmly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “service of a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: atelierparis
Reviews.Content: rooms are quite small and the bathrooms are a bit old and not very posh. but the locations is perfect and feels very safe all over in this nice area. the service was to perfection from start to beginning!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The details matter, too”
Reviews.Author: lonepaddler
Reviews.Content: This has to qualify as one of the best-located hotels in Paris. Truly, I found it a true delight to look out the window of our small twin room and see the St Germain church every day. The hotel staff was young, professional, and welcoming. Still, I was surprised by the cheap quality of the room furniture which looked as if it had been purchased at Ikea, and the curtain which was missing a few hooks and gave the room a sadly hostel-like feel. It did not help that the evening turn-down crew left a bag full of someone else's trash (cigarette packet and butts, no less) on top of my daughter's luggage and a wash rag in our bathroom the next evening. This kind of inattention should not happen at a hotel with this number of stars. And if the hotel happens to be a Design Hotel, shouldn't there be some of that (ie. Design) in the bedrooms? The bathrooms were indistinguishable from those of a Motel-6. The toiletries were no-name and the bath towels skimpy. Windows are well glazed but sound within the hotel is more of a problem. I would stay here again only if the rate were really, really attractive, but I do think that the hotel has real potention with some updating and management oversight.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay at the Bel-Ami”
Reviews.Author: parisgirlnj
Reviews.Content: Granted it's almost a year since I visited the Bel-Ami, but I stayed here two years in a row--Dec 2007 and 2008--on one-week trips to Paris with my parents (who are in their late 60s/early 70s). If you want to be in St. Germain, the location of this friendly, stylish hotel can't be beat. Quaint side street just around the corner from the church and Les Deux Magots. Decor is modern, the staff is young and helpful, the breakfast room is lovely (and the breakfast itself is lovely too). Rooms are small but tasteful, can be a bit noisy depending on position, beds very comfortable. If you can find a good deal and you want to experience St. Germain neighborhood, you should not hesitate to stay here! If you're paying top dollar you might feel disappointed/wish for a bigger room/etc., but that's not easy in this location. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in St. Germain”
Reviews.Author: mrbender
Reviews.Content: No issues with the hotel. Rooms are small as expected, but the location makes it worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: SyamKa
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Bel Ami Hotel and hopefully won't be the last. We absolutely enjoy the St. Germain district and this hotel is right in the middle of everything. At the same time it is very close to Louvre and withing a reasonable distance to Notre Dame de Paris. The hotel is modern and very nice. It has a nice setting downstairs with a bar. The staff is very helpful and welcoming. Our room was a standard room with a queen size bed! Finally, we didn't have to endure the two twin beds moved together. The room was small, but we never complain about that because it is never an issue to us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Vincent V
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night. This hotel truly has an excellent location. The rooms are a little bit small but this is normal in Paris. Quite good value for money...

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Jose030
Reviews.Content: Bel Ami is a confortable and modern hotel. I visit Paris since 1983 and is a first time I find a hotel with a educated staff, mainly the barman and reception team. The location is great and the service is great. I recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Superior service provided from the moment I booked”
Reviews.Author: lemoncino
Reviews.Content: I would like to commend the staff and management of Bel-Ami in Paris. My husband and I were travelling with our 3-month old baby and therefore had some extra requests. Whenever I contacted the hotel via email the appropriate person responded quickly and in a very friendly manner. They organised a crib for the baby and also a transfer from the train station. Upon arrival two staff members saw the provate car and came straight out and down the street to help with our baggage. The hotel itself is very modern and clean, located just down the road from the famous Le Deux Maggots cafe in Saint Germain. Breakfast was wonderful and the staff kept filling the empty trays and bowls, even just before breakfast was suppose to end. Our room was very quiet with respect to street noise. The bed and pillows were wonderful. The bathroom very clean. The only downside was the room size. Even though we had upgraded to a superior it was still quite small. However this is unstandable given the fantastic location on the hotel and reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in excellent place”
Reviews.Author: MillefeuilleMoscow
Reviews.Content: We have spent 3 nights in this hotel and all we can say it is wonderful place to stay. Very modern design, friendly staff, nice rooms and breakfast. Bit of advice: rooms overlooking a street might be noisy, although traffic is not that intensive. We enjoyed that staff spoke our language and is very well trained. Lots of places to eat and drink nearby. We walked on foot everywhere from Louvre to Musee Rodin...

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good safe bet”
Reviews.Author: upmayo
Reviews.Content: I am posting mainly to show photos of the Bel Ami room we stayed in. The hotel is a bit modern / minimalist and didn't have much atmosphere/personality, but overall it was a pleasant choice. Having researched hotels on trip advisor I was most concerned about not having a bad hotel experience which spoiled the whole trip. As it turned out the room was big to be comfortable, the bathroom had a shower and we had internet access in the room (they also have 3 or 4 computers for internet access in the lobby also). The front desk staff and concierge were polite and eager to help. The breakfast staff were very pleasant. The breakfast is a a buffet with a good selection. Tip: When making the reservation negotiate for breakfast included. We didn't and I recall that the per person cost of the breakfast was high. Bel Ami is in a great spot in St. Germaine de Pres near restaurants. Its near the St. Germaine de Pres church / metro station. 2 tips on the metro for first timers: (i) if you have had a long flight just get a taxi to your hotel - its not worth trying to figure out the metro system when you are worn out; (ii) don't get the metro weekly pass tickets that require a photo. We bought these and went through the gate and were both immediately fined for not having photos (something like Euro 50 each) which was the low point of our trip - it really felt like we were taken advantage of because we didn't know. The Metro itself was a disappointment - my view is the London underground is a better service. You walk up and down so many steps and for such long distances that most of the time you are better just strolling along at street level. For restaurants near the Bel Ami try the "le Relais de L'Entrecote" which is about 30 yards from the hotel entrance and across the street - its steak and only steak, with a secret sauce. They keep a second helping on a heated side plate so that you get it hot. Its the only restaurant we were in that had female servers. Right beside the hotel is another restaurant with a green exterior worth a try called Le Petit Zinc - we had a great first meal there but made the mistake of ordering lamb the 2nd night: we now know that the French serve their lamb raw, regardless of how you order it. [Last tip - don't order lamb in Paris unless you like it served with a pulse]. If you don't mind a 10 min. stroll try La Rotisserie d'en Face and Chez Fernand, both on Rue Christine which is a small side street about half way down Rue Dauphine (the road which leads to Pont Neuf).

Reviews.Title: “5 stars for location, 4 stars for staff and breakfast, 3 stars for room colour, OVERALL 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: CouplefromSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bel Ami in April for 6 nights. We chose it even after reading the mixed reviews because we decided that its location outweighed any of the faults identified by others. We requested a quiet room as we are both extremely light sleepers and mentioned that we were celebrating our anniversary, which we were. The room was indeed quiet, and even though there might have been some noisy guests, we heard nothing from 10 pm to 7 am. We definitely did not hear any noise from outside the hotel. To mark our anniversary, the hotel offered us complimentary champagne in the bar (with some nibbles) and because it was around Easter, we got a couple of exquisite chocolate Easter eggs as well. The staff and breakfast were very good. Loved the freshly squeezed OJ and Danone yoghurt. Breakfast included scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, hardboiled eggs, salad, fresh fruit (orange, apple, banana, kiwi, grapefruit etc) pastries and croissants, jams, cold cuts, tinned fruit, tea, coffee, different breads, bottled water etc. Free newspapers were available in the breakfast room. You could get more orange juice if you asked. Grapefruit and apple juices were the other choices. Because we stayed for a while, we did not have to ask for more orange juice after the first day. They would simply offer more. Speaking of orange, the superior room we stayed in was orange in colour...different shades of orange...which was not very pleasing to us from a design perspective, however, it did not affect our sleep. Loved the fact that the loo is separate from the bathroom/shower. Loved the huge bed, too! LOCATION could not have been better. Saint Germain is a terrific area and as we love to walk everywhere, this was the best location. Quiet yet accessible. For groceries check out Champion supermarket on Rue Seine or Monoprix on Rue Rennes. We went to the former. For dinner, we went to the restaurant opposite the pastry shop Laduree -- I believe it is called Pre Aux Clercs or something similar. Would we stay at Bel Ami again? Definitely! It should be noted that we have stayed at MaMaison Sulekova in Bratislava (see review on Trip Advisor) and Hotel Roemer in Amsterdam (we might write a review for this hotel, which we absolutely loved). Oh, and before we forget, the free internet in the Bel Ami lobby did not always work for us, i.e., we could not always access all websites (eg hotmail) on some days and times...a blessing in a way, when you are on a romantic holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, don't care for guests”
Reviews.Author: Sviz
Reviews.Content: It's a great hotel in a magnificent location, can't get any better my opinion. If everything is OK, then this is great, but if you are planning a special occasion visit, beware, you might be disappointed. We went there for our 10th anniversary honeymoon. During our whole 10 days stay, the next door apartment was being renovated, which meant, that the smell of plaster, the banging and seesawing started at 9 and would go on through the day. My each complain was net with - yes we could move you, but its going to stop tomorrow. Never did so. I have noticed, that in general this is a great place, but the hotel lives its own life and if it ruins someones holiday, they really don't care, so again, if you are planning something special, a romantic trip, just beware it can be ruined in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Neither gracious nor organised”
Reviews.Author: joanne7575
Reviews.Content: We stay around the corner from the Bel Ami and noticed that they have a spa facility now that is available to non-guests. We went in to book treatments directly with the spa but no one was around at 11 am so went to the concierge who booked us in for the next day and took our credit card numbers to guarantee the treatments. Imagine our surprise when we arrived to find out the bookings were for the wrong day. The woman at the spa acted like it was our fault and the concierge, well, he shrugged his hands in the air. As we were spending 200 euro with the spa, it would have been nice if there had been even a sincere apology. We've considered staying at the Bel Ami but certainly not now.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alzadjalia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a lovely boutique hotel in the heart of St Germain. There are many lovely cafes and boutiques around the area including the infamous cafe de Flore which is just around the corner. The staff were very very friendly and the service was superb. The hotel staff were very well trained which made a huge difference to my stay. However, they unfortunately misinformed all hotel guests about strikes in Paris which meant that I spent the day walking and couldn't get to some places I wanted to go. The rooms were spotless and a reasonable size with free wifi access. The hotel has a small gym which is great for its purpose. I managed to get an excellent rate through the internet, so it was definitely value for money. Overall, I had a great experience and would definitely return to the Bel Ami.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, helpful staff, beautiful location!”
Reviews.Author: deadviasatellite
Reviews.Content: I have nothing bad to say about this hotel. From the moment we arrived until the moment we left we found the staff helpful and friendly. The hotel is very well maintained; decor is very stylish and the rooms are spotless. I was one of a party of four with two twin rooms booked, and the only worry I had about staying here was that our room was going to be tiny, going by the reviews on this site. My room was upgraded from a standard to a superior without even requesting it upon check in (thank you, kind monsieur!) and had plenty of space for the two of us with suitcases, though there was a large wardrobe available. Bathroom was large with a tub. I thought our companions' room was going to turn out a lot smaller than ours (they only had one superiour room left, lucky us), but after going to have a look I found that the standard rooms are only marginally smaller and still spacious, so not sure what all the complaints about small rooms are about! Breakfast lasts for a generous 4 hours (6:30 - 10:30), plenty on offer and all delicious! Internet access is available for free in the lobby and there is also free Wifi throughout the hotel. There is a spa but we didn't try it out. The location of this hotel is wonderful, centrally located in the heart of St. Germain and only around the corner from a metro station. All in all, I wish I was still there!

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: PT_HunterValley
Reviews.Content: I booked four rooms for four nights over New Year for my family. Did the booking over the internet. No problems. The location is wonderful in Saint Germain des Pres. I think this is the best part of Paris. It is near the Seine and has all the wonderful Bistros and Brasseries of the Left Bank. The hotel is only a very short walk to the St Germain Metro station. The rooms were delightful. Not large by Asian or Australian standards but big enough and well designed and nicely appointed. The staff were very helpful and friendly. They worked hard before we arrived to arrange somewhere for us to spend New Years Eve and they provided on-going assistance throughout the stay. The atmosphere is very relaxed and my family enjoyed its stay here enormously.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hampdenLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Bel Ami is a great place to stay in Paris. The location is perfect. You are within walking distance of a lot of Paris's sites and some really great Cafes, such as Cafe Flores. The rooms are clean and comfortable and appropriate for the price of the room. During our stay everyone was friendly and no issues came up at all. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great People”
Reviews.Author: Jellyfafafa
Reviews.Content: My husband I just spend 8D/7N in this hotel. This hotel is excellent. The room size is small (16sqm), but I think you cannot expect too much in Paris thou. The room looks a bit old, but I think that is totally acceptable. We got 3 large luggages and 2 hand carry, but we still manage to pack our things up in the room. The location is great. 3 mins walk to the St, Germain station. Many cafes and restaurants around within 10 mins walk. If you like shopping, LV, Dior and other brand shop is around the hotel. The service at this hotel is excellent which is comparable to a 5 star hotel. The staff at concierge services are very helpful. My husband and I seeks their advice for dining, they are very helpful, especially the guy named Benjaman. He speaks very good english and offer wonderful services. However, afterall you cannot expect too much from the breakfast buffet which has very limited choice of food as the hotel do not run a proper restaurant itself. I enjoy very much to stay in this hotel, and definately will go back when I go Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, horrible organization! BEWARE DO NOT LEAVE YOUR CC!”
Reviews.Author: cashcat
Reviews.Content: Loved location, rooms small but pleasant, clean. Got a wake up call at 5am I didn't need, (asked for 7am). Booked through work, work pre paid to get a special rate. Two weeks later they claimed it wasnt paid we faxed them our receipt then they acknowlegded it was paid. Get to the hotel, confirm all is paid, upon check out they claim it wasnt paid (didnt we do this before?) so they charged me AGAIN only a new and higher rate, then I get back to NY and my company gives me a copy of the Amex statement showing it was paid and still fighting it to this day, what a disaster. Not for the business traveler!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great people, great location”
Reviews.Author: PGA2
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the middle of everything in Paris this is a great choice. Its well situated for the Metro or you can walk to many things. Yet its off the busy St Germain Blvd so you give up some noise. The hotel itself was flawless. I loved all the Duravitt and Hansgrohe in the bathroom. 2 flat screens and an IPod radio. This is not your standard US chain hotel room. The staff was so very pleasant and able to help us with all those mindless tourist questions. I especially appreciated the free internet access in the lobby. We actually had a suite and could not have been happier. I would certainly stay here again and highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Bel-Ami”
Reviews.Author: Philly_Traveler_512
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bel-Ami for 4 nights in August. Could't have been more pleased. Great location, friendly helpful staff, very clean accomodations - nice boutique hotel. Room was small, which was expected for Paris, but not tiny - never was an issue for my wife and I who were in Paris on our Honeymoon. Some negativeTrip Advisor reviews made us a bit nervous, but honestly nothing to worry about. If you chose the Bel-Ami , you made a great choice. Breakfast was included with our stay, St Germain Metro Stop, Cafe Deux Magots, Cafe De Flore, shopping are all right around the corner. Located within easy walking distance to the Seine, Louvre, Latin Quarter and more............. A great time in a great place, would definetly return to the Bel -Ami

Reviews.Title: “WILDLY over-rated - BEWARE!”
Reviews.Author: jserseypeach
Reviews.Content: On the strength of the reviews posted here, we chose this hotel for our anniversary trip to Paris - it was bit more than we usually pay, but we wanted to splash out on somewhere great. Our advice after staying there for 3 nights - DON'T BOTHER! THIS PLACE IS OVER-RATED!! The good stuff - nice location, great staff, pretty good breakfast are all NOTHING compared to the BORING old-hat minimal decor, TINY rooms, NO atmospshere, POORLY DESIGNED public areas, DINGEY corridors, LAUGHABLE why-bother gym, COMPLETE LACK of any real design flair or nice touches like quality toiletries. THIS PLACE NEEDS A MAKOVER! RE-DECORATE - THE WALLS BEHIND RECEPTION ARE GRUBBY! Quite how this place is so highly rated I don't understand - you go on holiday to Paris for romance, beauty, art & design flair, delightful touches of glamour and eccentricity, a convivial atmosphere - WHERE ARE THESE AT BEL AMI? Really guys, if you are after ANY of the above for a special Paris trip - LOOK ELSEWHERE! THIS PLACE IS OVER-PRICED, OVER-RATED AND UNDERWHELMING. Which when you are spending at this level, you really don't want to here your self say... Let this be the review that puts people off.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastique!”
Reviews.Author: sla7elw
Reviews.Content: This really is a fantastic find right in the centre of Paris. The hotel is well situated in the middle of the St Germain des Pres area and is within walking distance of the Louvre. The rooms are comfortable and well equipped and the beds are the kind where you sink in and don't want to get up again! My room was overlooking Rue St Benoit and was extremely quiet. Staff are friendly and go out of their way to help. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend Bel Ami”
Reviews.Author: viva_holidays
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved our stay at Bel Ami. After many hours of searching on the internet, we found the reviews on TripAdvisor to be very useful and decided on Bel Ami based on these. We were not disappointed. Our driver easily found the location of the hotel. It is on a quiet street and we didn't hear any of the noise from the festivities going on in the neighbourhood. The hotel is in a great location, within walking distance to most of the popular sights and with an abundance of restaurants to choose from. The hotel itself is hip and modern. We chose a superior room and whilst it was perhaps on the small side, it was everything we needed. The bed linen was some of the best we have ever had in a hotel and the towels were also of a very good quality. The dressing gowns were also a nice touch. The bathroom size was also bigger than we expected. The bed was extremely comfortable and we found the cupboard space to be sufficient. Breakfast was included in our stay and we enjoyed having this option available to us. The breakfast room opened early which was great since we had some early starts. The free internet access in the lobby was also a nice touch and we found the computers to be generally available when we needed them. The lobby area was also very air-conditioned and it was very pleasant to come back after a long hot day out and walk into a cool hotel. All in all, Bel Ami was a wonderful place to stay and we would definitely stay there again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “a real gem”
Reviews.Author: Hamish234
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bel Ami is rated as a 4-star boutique hotel in the Saint Germain district of Paris. Having spent 5 nights in a junior suite, my wife and I consider the hotel to be a 5-star little gem. The location is ideal as it is a stone"s throw from fashionable and lively Boulevard Saint Germain,upscale restaurants,art galleries,shops,museums,public transportation and the river cruise. It is a bustling, lively area but the hotel is soundproof, modern and has a home-style atmosphere. The hotel staff is simply superlative.They go out of their way to be helpful and every request is attended to in a friendly and efficient manner. The concierge is very knowledgeable and communicates in excellent English ( as well as French). The breakfast buffet is included in the price of the room and is sumptuous with a variety of hot and cold dishes. The staff in the dining room seems to outnumber the guests because they remove dirty dishes, refill coffee cups and clean the tables instantly. Newspapers in every language are available free of charge in the dining room and in the lobby. Are there any negatives about the hotel? The standard (deluxe and superior) rooms are small. The junior suite (room 118) is the ideal size with a small but useful sitting room, a beautiful bathroom with 2 sinks, a separate bath and shower and a plentiful supply of towels. The room is cleaned as soon as you leave in the morning and the turn down service in the evening includes fresh towels. The price for the junior suite is considerably more than the standard size room, but certainly not expensive by Paris standards and was well worth it for us.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TristenAustralia
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at the Bel-ami hotel for 3 nights and loved it. Its a fantastic location with very friendly staff, especially the concierge who was very helpful. The rooms are a little small, like the rest of europes hotels but the comfortable beds and clean rooms make up for it. The breakfast provided was lovely filled with yummy pastries and local cheeses. A great little sitting area with a bar in the foyer is great to meet for a drink to either start your evening or end your evening. Great way to end our trip and I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel as our stay was a very pleasant stay. Irene Australia

Reviews.Title: “Great location, atmosphere and service…”
Reviews.Author: dashadam
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bel Ami for 3 nights as part of a trip to Europe in April-08. This was my second trip to Paris and I spent a fair bit of time researching my hotel before choosing the Bel Ami. I can thoroughly recommend the Bel Ami and found all elements of my stay to be excellent. The Bel Ami is located in St Germain de Pres and its location is one of the major assets of the hotel. You are right in the heart of Paris with great walking-distance access to all the key sights (Louvre, Louvre, Place de la Concorde, The Musee D'Orsay etc.). One of Paris’s most historic bistro’s, Café de Flore is at the end of the street while a Laduree (an amazing patisserie) is around the corner.. The St Germain de Pres metro station is also around the corner making it easy to access the airport via the train. During my entire stay in Paris I was able to walk to all areas I needed to go without any hassle. The hotel is located in a small side street making it a quiet area with no noise or disruptions. The Bel Ami has a boutique stylish feel about it. Both the lobby and the rooms are very well appointed and there is a comfortable and relaxed feel about the hotel. Check-in was well handled. My room was (as expected) somewhat smallish however this is a given for most European hotels. An intelligent room layout and good use of furniture however made maximum use of the space. My room had a contemporary and stylish feel to it with nice warm colours. The bathroom was spacious and again was well appointed and decorated. The bed was extremely comfortable. Housekeeping did an excellent job everyday and the room was very clean. My room felt very new and was in great condition. My dealings with the staff were minimal- everything was so well handled and run that there wasn’t much need- however when I did speak to someone service was extremely professional and consistent. I found everyone I dealt with to be very helpful and there is a warm yet courteous feel to the service that the hotel delivers. Everyone had good English language skills which was handy as my French is still less than impressive… Breakfast was nice without being amazing. A cold continental breakfast is served which was ok however given the exceptional range of eateries in the area and the amazing patisseries you have access to, on most days I went out for breakfast. There is a small yet stylish gym with a great fish tank. Complimentary computers and internet in the lobby are a good touch if you aren’t travelling with a laptop. As a traveller I’m looking for a good deal that offers me a great boutique style experience- I’m particular about cleanliness, good food and strong service. The Bel Ami delivered for me in all these areas and enhanced my stay in this magical city. I’ve read some mixed reviews about this hotel on this site however my stay was exceptional and I will be coming back next time I’m in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel with a nice location!”
Reviews.Author: poopydoopy
Reviews.Content: Located only 2 short blocks from St Germain de Pres station, this hotel is located in a very safe/clean area of paris. The lobby is cozy and modern with free internet access for guests. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean, a little small, but to be expected in europe. The staff was friendly and helpful. The free breakfast buffet had a wide variety of food, not ur typical croissants/fruits/juices. Included several choices of cereals, pastries, fruits, bacon/eggs, etc...along with all sorts of coffee/juices. Depending on ur budget, it's down the street from Les Deux Magots, we're told they serve the most expensive cup of coffee in Paris. Lots of high end shopping/restaurants near by but we also found a few small eateries (for budget travelers like us). :) Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at the Bel Ami and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: m_donaghy
Reviews.Content: This is great little hotel. Very handy location. It was very clean which i always look for in a hotel. Rooms were small but modern. Exactly what i expected. Breakfast was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and great location”
Reviews.Author: Bergkamp9999
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for two nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. The location is perfect for both shopping and sightseeing. The room was small but clean and decorated in a minimalist style. The overall quality of the room was very high. Breakfast was a buffet with a good selection, except for the poor choice of bread. If you feel you need to stock up with pastries etc, walk round the corner to Rue Jacob where you'll find Laduree, an excellent and very busy patisserie. I can strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CalEuroTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bel Ami for a week in May. I was travelling alone and it was the best location I could ever imagine. I had a few issues but they would not preclude me from returning. I will tell you the few issues first. The hotel staff was friendly, but the concierge the first day had me get off at the wrong Metro station for the Pere Lachaise cemetery and I walked 45 minutes to get there after I got off the Metro. But it was a pleasant walk! The only other glitch was the a/c, that was leaking water and all they did was turn it off to "fix it" . Luckily it was not hot. The hotel is small as are the rooms and bathroom, typical for Paris. But it was comfortable, clean, had modern decor (which I love) and a nice breakfast. There's a small restaurant/bar for a light snack or some cognac. The clientele, when I was there, seemed to be mostly European. The location is so ideal, especially for someone travelling alone. The Metro station at St Germain des Pres is at the corner, as is the famous Cafe de Flore. The very popular Les Relais de L'Entrecote is across the street - they have a set steak menu that is excellent. There are two Jazz cafes and a few other restaurants on the same street. Several other restaurants and cafes are within 5-10 minutes walking distance. Also on Rue St Benoit is UPLA, a wonderful handbag store. I bought a few. Wonderful nylon and leather messenger bags and other styles. Compared to designer bags, they are quite reasonable and different. I have never seen them in the US. Also within walking distance is some of the best shopping in Paris. Countless boutiques for shoes, sportswear, bags, jewellery, paper, etc are all over the place. Le Bon Marche, a beautiful department store, is about a 15 minute walk. They have a unique cosmetic and accessories department. I have never seen so many beautiful scarves. There is also a La Maison du Chocolat near Le Bon Marche where I bought truffles and other chocolates that were superb. The hotel "arrival gift" was a box of cookies from Laduree and they were unbelievable. I would never have known about them if I hadn't stayed at the Bel-Ami. There is a Laduree in St Germain des Pres and one on the Champs. I was also within walking distance of the Louvre, Place de la Concorde, The Musee D'Orsay and the L'Orangerie. With the Metro right there, you can get anywhere quite quickly. The Bel-Ami is not cheap, but well worth the location and its relaxing simplicity.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sallyandjohn2
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Rooms a bit small but that was expected. Location is fantastic. I walked everywhere. Will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel & Area”
Reviews.Author: Middletonlass
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in fab location. On a side street near St Germain Des Pres square. Quiet. The rooms are medium sized and stylish with everything that you want except tea making facilities! Breakfast is a superb buffet style & there is a nice bar area. Free access to the internet in the lobby. All staff were 10/10, courteous, friendly, helpful & spoke excellent English when needed. Nothing was too much trouble. The area is on the edge of the Latin Quarter near the Sorbonne Uni, so lots of students of all nationalities about. Lots of bistros, restaurants, cafes & a few pubs! Some lovely restaurants & cafes right by the hotel and for more french fare, mix with the locals in the Rue Gusarde, a whole street of bistros. Off of this street is the Rue Princesse, home to the Frog & Princess, an English speaking pub which brews its own lager on the premises and serves great cocktails. Home of the students, so cheapish drink & food. The whole area was safe to walk around in the daytime & at night. Busy at all times. The hotel is within walking distance of the main attractions, a short distance away from the Seine, Louvre, Musee Orsay & Notre Dame. There is a Tourist Bus stop by the Seine & the river Autobus, a hop off hop on tourist boat. Great fun. All in all a great hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Love It Every Year- 8 Years and Counting....”
Reviews.Author: emilyinparis
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Bel-Ami more than 10 times over the past 8 years. I have witnesed the re-styling of the hotel rooms and lobby and the expansion of the restaurant. Every time, it has been superb! The front desk service is wonderful and the free internet in the lobby is a major plus. The rooms are small, but quiet, stylishly modern and clean. The location could not be more pefect. Be sure to pocket a few extra of the leaf-shaped complimentary soaps- they smell amazing. Also, don't miss out on the hot chocolate at breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: BCSandman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after our tour through France for an extra 3 nights. After staying at a few hotels ranging from 3-4 stars and being quite disappointed by most of them we were a littel wary of this one. Fortunately, once we got to the hotel we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is in a great location within walking distance to anything you need. The lobby and staff were great. Once we got through the clean hallway to our room, we opened the door to a really cute and tastefully decorated room. Although it is small, it looks great and is clean. We really enjoyed our stay here and I would definitely stay at the Bel Ami again. The breakfast is good and free access to the internet to email home is a plus. The staff here really went out of their way to ensure we were happy.

Reviews.Title: “Need a hotel in Paris? look no further...”
Reviews.Author: cag18
Reviews.Content: Dear traveler Here is a review for the Bel Ami hotel, on the Rue de Benoit, Paris. I have stayed here on 4 occasions now, and I have to say, after each visit, I can't help but grow ever more attached to this hotel. However, lets briefly go through the less positive (in my opinion). Cost - Expect rooms to be from Euro 300- 450 per night, depending on season and availability. On top of this, you can add 24 Euros for the breakfast. The rooms are generally small in size, but this is to be expected in Paris. Some of the rooms are showing wear and tear - although I do hear rumours they are re-furbishing! This is good news. For people not willing or able to take the stairs to their rooms, prepare for delays, as the lifts are slow, if working at all (perhaps I am just really unlucky..). When warm, the rooms can get warm - I have never been too impressed with the A/C system. So,on to the positive. I love the location. The St. Germain de pres area is lovely, by day and evening. There are plenty of great shops locally - including Hugo Boss just around the corner, and also Louis Vuitton, practically next door. For food and drink venture out on the street and prepare to be satisfied regardless of turning gauche, or droit. My personal fave is the Alcazar (Conran) restaurant and bar about 10 mins away. Ask concierge for reservation and directions. Simple tasty food, and nice mezzanine bar upstairs. Despite the size of the rooms, they are extremely comfortable. The area is pretty quiet, so sleep is not a problem. Bathrooms are quite acceptable too - and the complementary soaps are actually quite pleasant - although Molton Brown would certainly be very welcome... The bar downstairs near the reception is small, but can be a nice venue to meet with colleagues or friends. The drinks are costly though (get your colleagues to pay!!), and there is not much to remind you that you are in one of the finest cities in the world - so I recommend taking your hard earnt Euros out into the nightlife of the city. There is a small (!!) fitness room, complete with fish swimming in the wall!! Fantastic. There is the option for massage/treatment too, but I have not had the chance so far during my visits. Breakfast is 24 Euros, so perhaps better to pop out and explore the backstreets of the left bank and pick up some Croissants or Pain au Chocolat instead - but if you prefer to eat in then you are in store for a nice mixture of foods, from cereals, pastries and fruits, through to fried delights. The sausages are wonderful. If you stay multiple nights and take your breakfast downstairs, notice how the waiters remember your preferred seating area, and juice variety. Nice touch. Concierge are helpful, and friendly. They always seem to have the right connections to get you what you need, regardless of the lack of notice. I recommend chatting to these chaps. All in all, having stayed at this hotel these 4 times, I would recommend any good friend to stay at this Hotel Bel Ami. I certainly look forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelwithoutmoving
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay here. Good location, nice rooms, nice staff a genuinely pleasant boutique hotel Take some water though, 8 euros for a small bottle of water from the mini bar (which incidentally contains no alcohol) is just astonishing. they must be making 1000% + on this. water is one of life's necessities and its a poke in the eye to charge this for it. i will never get used to this behaviour in hotels. oh and take some shower gel, they ran out of that. other than that, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great location but a a little dissappointing”
Reviews.Author: dublintraveldublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Jan 2007 and while the location is absolutely fantastic the hotel was dissappointing. We seemed to be close to a service entry point or airconditioning unit, when we asked to be moved they told us there was in fact no noise - we had to insist and get them to come up to the room. They then agreed to change our room. But there was no apology. The room was small but that is usual for Paris. The next time I would definately stay in this area but might try one of the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, but on the edge of being overpriced”
Reviews.Author: theshoemaker
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the bel-ami for a few nights with my fiancee, we chose the hotel based on a good location and rather good reviews. overall we enjoyed our stay but had a few setbacks. our superior room was extremely small, we were aware of this in advance but it was small even compared to a similar ones we've been to in new york and london. apparently the narrow 4 meter long hallway counted in on the squares it had because I doubt it was really 18m2. the room was quite cozy though, but this was disrupted during the first morning. after 8 I woke up to a banging sounds. it repeated every 5 minutes or so. it was followed by and odd rumbling sound that moved downwards fast. I later figured the room behind the wall was a room service space and the sound came from the staff going in and out, probably with their cleaning carts. the rumbling might've been a laundry chute of some sort? after 9 in the morning there were different noices cause by some construction work or somthing, too.
