I didnt get the wireless internet to work, could've probably been sorted at the desk but since they had computers in the lobby I didnt bother nor have the need to ask about it. breakfast was included in our rate, it was basic and good, the breakfast room being very nice. what I wondered was why they hadn't placed the bar (just renovated I think) into that location because it would've been next to the street. now it was sort of at the back of the lobby - unoticable from outside and thus empty. the location of the hotel - in the heart of st. germain, was of course great. taxi drivers had some problems knowing it but most recognized the street name or found it on their gps, atleast. staff was friendly, no complaints there. overall we liked the hotel, even though our stay was not as peaceful as it could've been due to bad luck with the room being next to a service room. however, in comparison, we've stayed at equally nice hotels in terms of room size, location etc for cheaper even in london. so that makes me think if its really worh the price, or could some other place be equally good or even better for 50 euros less per night? next time we'll be likely to test some other place.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kr8sus
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in Bel-Ami for two nights in February, and loved it there. The location is excellent, quiet yet central, and the service was perfect. The staff were really helpful with booking tables at restaurants, recommended where we should go and acommodated us with our wish for late check-out without frowning. The fact that you can get your breakfast (LARGE one as well!) served to your room without extra cost is 5-star!! We have absolutely no complaints regarding this hotel and would definitely recommend it to everyone who would like to stay in the Latin Quartier.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikeyb0y
Reviews.Content: Was quite pleased with the bel ami as the last couple of reviews were not too good. The room was small but clean. Being where it was, did not expect it to be large anyway. The location is great with great cafe's and shops all within walking distance. Had some nice cocktails in the bar and the lounge had free internet access. The staff were very friendly and the concierge recommended and booked a great restaurant for the Saturday evening. The only downsides are that we had to change the keycard 3 times and free internet access in the room would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “JACKHAMMERS AND CHANGED PRICE”
Reviews.Author: jerroldjay
Reviews.Content: I am currently sitting in the lobby of this hotel writing my comments on the free internet in the lobby.(nice feature) The sound of a jackhammer or large compressor pulsates through the entire hotel. The sound starts at 8:30 A.M. continues untill 5 P.M. If you arrive with jet lag or just want a nap at mid day, this is not the hotel for you. If you wish to read in the lobby, forget it. Everyone in the hotel comes to the front desk and asks about the noise. The seem to think it is the guests problem since they did not ask if the hotel had any constuction when they booked the room. We had originally booked a superior room for the nights at the low season rate of €310 per night and then added one more day for an earlier arrival at €350 per night (high season rate) At arrival we were informed the charges would be €350 for two nites and €310 for the other two. I feel cheated on more than one level.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: dolog
Reviews.Content: Great location - one of the best in the city. Nice, clean hotel, good breakfast - bad card key system. The minute you put your card key next to a cell phone, it diactivates and you have to go and get a new one. Not very convenient but other than that, a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MissmydoginCT
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel every year for the past 10 years. The decor has changed over the years from more traditional to contemporary, boutique, but the service and comfort has remained excellent. Right next to the Egise St Germain, it is a wonderful neighborhood filled with charm, history, great shopping and restaurants. I don't love some of the colors they have used in the most recent hotel redecoration, especially the orange rooms but you can request the rooms you like, and the beds and bathrooms are all very user friendly. The breakfast room has moved from the basement to the first floor streetside which is a big improvment. They offer some great package deals, which I usually take advantage of if staying for more than one night. Everyone speaks english and they have the most friendly staff I have ever encountered in Paris. You can come into the lobby after a long day and sit down at the complimentary computers and email home while you enjoy a cocktail from the bar. I will be returning this Nov.

Reviews.Title: “worth staying!”
Reviews.Author: Ziry
Reviews.Content: Great location, in the heart of St. Germain. Nice lobby, friendly staff, clean and comfortable room (could be a little bigger), honest breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Neil_Jung
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 nights there; the English receptionist was most welcoming - to my surprise she showed us up to our room whilst a porter brought the bags and refreshingly didn't hang around for a tip! The room and bathroom were compact but well-appointed and well decorated. There was no view to speak of but in such a central location (and having read about it beforehand) this was not a surprise and not an issue. We went out for a trip to the Eiffel Tower (having discussed the best route with the friendly concierge, although his walking time estimate of 30 minutes was very optimistic) and on our return found the bed had been turned down, which was a nice touch. The room was quiet. The safe worked. There were enough hangers. The breakfast was OK - they did tea, scrambled egg / bacon / sausage, croissants, cereal, juice, coffee, yoghurt. We were able to leave our luggage there after checking out. The hotel is very close to the St Germain Metro and some fine restaurants and cafes. With the exception of the famous one on the main road, where the waiter was as snooty as one would expect, we found the French waiters and shop staff very friendly and I was repeatedly surprised at the "bonjours" and "au revoirs" and their willingness to speak English back to my stuttering French. One interesting point is that taxi drivers don't know their way round Paris like they do in the UK; you'll need to know where the hotel on a map is if you want them to take you there! We would use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “You can Ring Ma Bel Ami - but only if you need to”
Reviews.Author: Sparkly*Euro*Peep
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only OK. It's not bad, it's just not special. Everything about it screams average. From the reception, to the "bar" (2 stools! but cute...), to the lifts, to the orange bedrooms, to the ordinary bathroom. It's location is great in St Germain and probably the best thing about it, together with the concierge, who seemed like the most well-connected person in Paris and got us into the coolest nightclubs. This is not a quaint little boutique hotel, it's a run-of-the-mill only ordinary place. I reiterate, not bad, just not special.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Tashtego
Reviews.Content: The reception staff were welcoming and helpful. Foyer and bar area was very modern and up market. The room was modern, clean and of a good size. Exactly what we were after. Breakfast was fantastic (heaps of fantastic food on offer) and the breakfast room was fabulously fitted out. Hotel also offered free internet which was great. Bel Ami is in a great area (St Germain) and is easy walking distance to the main sights. Everything we expected/wanted and made out stay in Paris memorable. Would definitiely recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Reminds Me of a "W" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from the Bel Ami. Felt like I was staying at the Paris branch of a W Hotel. Modern, chic lobby but chicness gets lost on way to rooms. My room was small, with thin carpet, more like felt over concrete(!), and very few amenities, not even a pen and scratchpad. Annoying that room lights won't come on unless you stick your room card in a slot by the door. Biggest problem each day was being awoken by room doors slamming up and down hall when other guests were coming and going. Yes, great location, but save your money for the shops rather than paying for the cool lobby ambience of the Bel Ami.

Reviews.Title: “Bel Ami -- C'est Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: hpliz
Reviews.Content: Bel Ami is the most wonderful hotel! It enjoys a perfect location on the Left Bank ... very close to Boulevard Saint Germain and the terrific restaurants in the area ... close to the Right Bank ... close to Ile de la Cite. We arrived by car and admit that we passed it on our first drive down the street -- it is on the left and has a VERY small sign. Second time around we DID find it, and someone immediately took our luggage from the car and whisked it away for the night. The hotel has a South Beach-y feel to it ... but without the attitude. The staff could not have been more pleasant -- special kudos to Jean Emmanuel at the Concierge Desk for his great suggestions and unlimited patience! Our room was a decent size ... we had a corner room overlooking the popular restaurants below. Perhaps all the windows made it feel less small. I was concerned that there would be a lot of street noise, but there wasn't. Double-glazed windows? The bathroom was small, but functional. Only one person at a time could occupy the space. We had an early flight the next morning. We received our two wake-up calls as promised. Since we were in a bit of a hurry we only wanted cafe au lait, not the inviting breakfast buffet. When we checked our bill, I told them that we had just had two coffees, but the charge was not listed. They said it was their pleasure and it was complimentary -- how delightful! And how unusual for Parisien hotels! Bel Ami is a small gem -- we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great business or tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: moosky595
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the back side of the hotel which was absolutely QUIET (even if there was no real view & we kept shades closed). We liked the clean European style of the hotel and the high standard of service by the young energetic staff. The neighborhood is exciting (if expensive). It's a great business hotel (PCs in the lobby); OR a hotel for an international tourist who likes modern European design & wants a sure thing (as opposed to taking one's chances w/ a family-run hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jaydriggers
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice - modern and clean (not the nicest ever, but certainly above average). Of all the times I have stayed in Paris, this place is the best - and in a perfect location, too. The staff is also fantastic. I have stayed in a few Paris hotels since and been somewhat disappointed, but in the future will return to Bel Ami with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Bel Ami my new beautiful friend”
Reviews.Author: PaigeTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel not only has a fabulous location on Left Bank but also has extremely friendly and knowledgeable staff, lovely rooms, great breakfast and fitness center and computer access too. I've tried a dozen different laft bank hotels in the last two years and this gets my top vote.

Reviews.Title: “Service service service personal personal personal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one-night stay at the Bel Ami. Had planned a two night stay but to our lasting regret only managed one. The hotel's location in St. Germain is fantastic, very very close to Cafe des Flores and Les Deux Magots (where you can have an amazing dish of quail stuffed with foie gras)...To die for! The area is reminiscent of Chelsea in London (if that helps) and is very well connected by metro etc. The hotel staff; from the bellboy who rushes out to help with the luggage, the reception staff who seem genuinely pleased to welcome you and the concierge who is the most helpful and friendly I have encountered, are the heart of this hotel and make staying at the Bel Ami an experience in personalised service. As another reviewer has mentioned, the staff really do welcome you by name. The rooms are not luxurious, but are chic and again personal as it appeared from a walk down the corridor that each was different. I would stay at the Bel Ami again without hesitation and would recommend anyone who wants a change from "corporate" hotels to try out its unique charm.

Reviews.Title: “Great Personal Service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The fact that you can be welcomed by name every time you walk into the lobby is impressive! That and the pink champagne at the bar of course! Superb location and great rooms - try Les Deux Magots for a famous bistro (albeit slightly disappointing menu)...

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced Hovel!”
Reviews.Author: acchi
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my son at the end of a three week trip thru France. I reserved a suite thinking we could each have our own space and T.V to watch at the end of a long day of business We took the train up from Vence and arrived very late. The doorman greeted us and swept our bags away. so far so good. Check in was swift and unecumbered, in our room within minutes. At check in the clerk mentioned the suite was one of two largest in the hotel. What a shock when we could not even fit all three bags in the bedroom! It was an oversized closet. The parlor attached to the bedroom was barely passable and the bedroom was simply unacceptable. The bathroom was spacious in relation to the rest of the room. The next morning we moved to an even smaller room, but we were no longer paying for a suite which had no business being called a suite. To the hotels credit they were very kind and suspiciously understanding. At the end of our one week stay the same clerk was on duty and he agreed the suite was not worth the money! As far as the other room goes, it was too small. The air conditioning did not work well and someone was trying to fix it all the time. Also, the rooms had an unattractive smell(also brought home in our suitcases)I pointed this out and once again it seemed the staff had heard this before.too. It sems as though the rugs were in desperate need of a shampoo! ICK! The breakfast was good but overpriced...25Euro for some rolls and one orange juice(guarded over by the dining manager). However, all the public rooms were spotless and the staff was genuinely helpful and kind. Also the female masseuse was fantastic. Very well trained in Asian therapy. If your feet hurt after long walking tours. Book ahead, she is great. One more F.Y.I. Book a high floor in the summer as the cigarette smoke is unbareable as it wafts down the street. This is a problem if the air conditioning is not working and the windows have to be open. We will not return...too many beautiful hotels...location or not!
